alert.note: Alert for Appling; Bacon; Coffee; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Coffee, Pierce, northwestern Ware, Bacon, western Wayne and Appling Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Glennville to 9 miles southwest of Dixie Union. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Jesup, Baxley, Alma, Blackshear, Patterson, Surrency, Screven, Odum and Offerman. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
